comment.text: Microtubule-binding motor protein probably involved in neuronal axonal transport. In vitro, has a plus-end directed motor activity (By similarity).

disease.name: Fibrosis of extraocular muscles, congenital, 1
disease.description: A congenital ocular motility disorder marked by restrictive ophthalmoplegia affecting extraocular muscles innervated by the oculomotor and/or trochlear nerves. It is clinically characterized by anchoring of the eyes in downward gaze, ptosis, and backward tilt of the head. Patients affected by congenital fibrosis of extraocular muscles type 1 show an absence of the superior division of the oculomotor nerve (cranial nerve III) and corresponding oculomotor subnuclei.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the TRAFAC class myosin-kinesin ATPase superfamily. Kinesin family.
